title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· 800 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B89@ . Photons with a wavelength of 800 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E9F@ have a lower frequency than those with a wavelength of 590 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ because frequency and wavelength are inversely proportional (ν= c λ ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FBD@ . Since frequency and energy are directly proportional (E=h ν) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4053@ , the lower frequency (shorter wavelength) photons have the lower energy.

The response provides the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· 800 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E9F@ . Photons with a wavelength of 800 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E9F@ have a lower frequency than those with a wavelength of 590 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ because frequency and wavelength are inversely proportional (ν= c λ ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FBD@ . Since frequency and energy are directly proportional (E=h ν) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4053@ , the lower frequency (shorter wavelength) photons have the lower energy.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Endothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration, of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of products at elevated temperature is consistent with an endothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

The response provides the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Endothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration, of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of products at elevated temperature is consistent with an endothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly describe the effect of the error.

· The estimated molarity of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ would be too low. The absorbance maximum of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ is at 590 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ , so setting the spectrophotometer to any other wavelength will result in a lower absorbance even if the concentration is unchanged. This lower absorbance would be misinterpreted as a lower concentration of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ than the actual concentration.

The response correctly describes the effect of the error.

· The estimated molarity of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ would be too low. The absorbance maximum of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ is at 590 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ , so setting the spectrophotometer to any other wavelength will result in a lower absorbance even if the concentration is unchanged. This lower absorbance would be misinterpreted as a lower concentration of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaaeiuaiaabkeaaaa@3B58@ than the actual concentration.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGpbGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaaaa@3BB2@ decreases, the collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently per unit of time. The lower frequency of collisions leads to a decreased rate of product formation and correspondingly a longer half-life of the reaction.

The response provides a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGpbGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaaaa@3BB2@ decreases, the collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently per unit of time. The lower frequency of collisions leads to a decreased rate of product formation and correspondingly a longer half-life of the reaction.
